PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: This less dependence of the polymer LUMO level on substituted alkyl chains is again consistent with the previous report.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) - This is a property of the polymer, which refers to the energy level of the lowest molecular orbitals in the polymer.
2. substituted alkyl chains - This is a property of the polymer, which refers to the type and number of alkyl groups (a type of organic molecule) that are substituted (attached) to the polymer backbone.

So, the two "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. LUMO
2. substituted alkyl chains
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure! Here are the entities that clearly refer to material properties in the given paragraph:

1. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) - This is a material property that refers to the energy level of the lowest molecular orbitals in a material.
2. substituted alkyl chains - This is a material property that refers to the type and number of alkyl groups (a type of organic molecule) that are substituted (attached) to a material's backbone.

So, the two material properties entities in the paragraph are:

1. LUMO
2. substituted alkyl chains

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |
| substituted alkyl chains |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
